‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL NEXT.JS 16 FEATURES:

1. REACT COMPILER (Stable)
- React Compiler is now stable and built-in to Next.js 16
- Provides AUTOMATIC memoization at the React component level
- Automatically stabilizes values/references and skips unnecessary re-renders
- Enable in next.config.js: experimental: { reactCompiler: true }
- Reference: https://nextjs.org/docs

2. CACHE COMPONENTS + INTEGRATED PPR
- New caching/pre-rendering model with integrated Partial Prerendering (PPR)
- Server-level control over what and when to cache/re-render
- Use 'use cache' directive for component-level caching
- Reference: https://nextjs.org/docs

‚ö†Ô∏è PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION CHANGES:

Due to React Compiler automatic memoization:

‚ùå AVOID useMemo/useCallback/React.memo in most cases:
- React Compiler handles memoization automatically
- These hooks are now needed only in specific edge cases
- If you suggest using these hooks, you MUST provide clear justification why automatic memoization is insufficient

‚úÖ When manual memoization MAY still be needed:
- Complex algorithms with heavy computations that Compiler cannot optimize
- Integration with third-party libraries that require stable references
- Specific performance bottlenecks identified through profiling
- Working with refs or imperative APIs

‚úÖ ALWAYS prefer in order:
1. React Server Components (RSC) - compute on server, send HTML
2. Pure functions and derived values - let Compiler optimize
3. Zustand for shared state - avoid local useState when possible
4. Only if absolutely necessary and justified - manual memoization hooks

üîß MIGRATION NOTES:
- Existing useMemo/useCallback can often be removed in Next.js 16
- React Compiler will warn about patterns it cannot optimize
- Test performance before and after removing manual memoization
- Keep Server Components as the default approach

üìö DOCUMENTATION:
- Next.js 16 docs: https://nextjs.org/docs
- React Compiler: https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/config/next-config-js/reactCompiler
- Cache Components: https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/directives/use-cache
